items.content: Horizons Middle East and Africa 1/30/2026 (Video)

Zelenskiy Says He’ll Accept Energy Strikes Truce If Putin Will - Ukraine is ready to halt strikes on energy infrastructure if Russia agrees to abide by a US proposal for a weeklong truce, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said.

Europe Gas Set for Biggest Monthly Gain Since 2023 Amid Cold Snaps - European natural gas headed for its biggest monthly gain in at least two years after cold spells and a rapid depletion of fuel inventories upended market sentiment.

How India’s Consumers Are Holding Up, According to a Major Shadow Lender - India is touted as the world’s next big consumption engine – but can policy, infrastructure and finance keep up? Shriram Finance Executive Vice Chairman Umesh Revankar, whose firm is one of India’s la

China Undershoots 2025 Spending Goal in Sign of Caution on Debt - China’s government spending fell short of plans in the budget for the seventh straight year in 2025, giving Beijing more fiscal firepower if the economy comes under pressure.

French Economy Kept Growing in Fourth Quarter - France’s economy kept growing at the end of last year as fourth-quarter output rose 0.2%, supported by stronger consumer spending and investment, according to statistics agency Insee. The figures mark

Air India Crash Probe Leans Toward Deliberate Pilot Action - India’s probe into last year’s Boeing Co. 787 jet crash is increasingly homing in on deliberate pilot action as the probable cause, according to people familiar with the findings, marking a concession
The China Show 1/30/2026 (Video)

Astra Signs Obesity Deal With CSPC Worth Up to $18.5 Billion - AstraZeneca Plc agreed an obesity drug deal with Chinese company CSPC Pharmaceutical Group Ltd. worth up to $18.5 billion, as the British drugmaker tries to push into the growing weight-loss market.

Permira Buys Stake in Fund Platform Carne at €1.4 Billion Value - Private equity firm Permira agreed to buy a significant minority stake in asset management platform Carne Group in a deal that values the Dublin-based firm at €1.4 billion ($1.7 billion).

France Blocked Eutelsat From Strategic Asset Sale, Lescure Says - French Finance Minister Roland Lescure said he blocked Eutelsat from selling a strategic asset, deploying the state’s powers to screen and intervene in investment from foreign entities.

Kioxia Seeks Growth in AI Storage While Rivals Chase HBM Profits - Flash memory maker Kioxia Holdings Corp. sees an opportunity to seize growth in high-density storage for AI data centers while its competitors are preoccupied elsewhere.
Kenyan Inflation Eases, Even as Food Prices Jump Amid Drought - Kenyan inflation eased in January, even after food prices jumped as a drought curbs food production.
Tokyo Gas Shares Rise After Firm Lifts Operating Income Forecast - Tokyo Gas Co. jumped Friday after the firm boosted its fiscal year guidance.

Wheat Eyes Biggest Monthly Gain Since May 2024 as Dollar Weakens - US wheat futures headed for the biggest monthly advance in nearly two years as a weaker dollar improved the appeal of the crop abroad.

Nomura’s Profit Falls on Europe Loss, Acquisition Costs - Nomura Holdings Inc.’s profit fell last quarter as a loss in Europe and one-time costs tied to a major acquisition overshadowed revenue growth in wealth management and equities trading.
Pound Falls Below $1.38, FTSE 100 Futures Steady

South African Stocks’ Record Monthly Run Moves Beyond Metals - South African equities are on track for their longest monthly winning streak on record as optimism mounts that the powerful commodities-driven rally is poised to broaden out to other sectors.

Spanish Growth Beats Estimates as France Defies Political Mayhem - Spain’s economy expanded more than anticipated at the end of last year as France kept growing, demonstrating Europe’s resilience to the trade turmoil unleashed by Donald Trump.

Invesco’s Yang on Potential Fed Chair Nominee - Fiona Yang, Asia Ex-Japan Equities Fund Manager at Invesco, shares her views on the potential market implications if Kevin Warsh were to be confirmed as the next Federal Reserve Chair.
